project.teaser: EVERPV’s objective is to provide EU with efficient solutions for a sustainable treatment of end-of-life PV panels and recovery of high purity and high integrity materials. Based on the grinding of PV panels waste from the backside and/or the use of IR lamps heating, EVERPV...
project.objective: EVERPV’s objective is to provide EU with efficient solutions for a sustainable treatment of end-of-life PV panels and recovery of high purity and high integrity materials. Based on the grinding of PV panels waste from the backside and/or the use of IR lamps heating, EVERPV will demonstrate two innovative technologies to delaminate the different layers of the PV panel. Combined with recycling processes, it will enable to recover glass with less than 1% impurities, encapsulant and backsheet polymers with a purity over 99%, and silver with a purity of 99%. Besides, the project will cluster with other EU-funded consortia already addressing the recycling of silicon (e.g. PHOTORAMA) to provide with a global solution. The new delamination technologies will be respectively demonstrated at ENVIE recycling plant and at 9TECH to reach TRL7. The technology demonstrated during EVERPV project targets to process more than 3000 tons of solar panels per year, thus recovering enough raw materials recovered to produce more than 350 000 new panels per year by 2030. EVERPV will finally demonstrate the potential for reusability of recovered materials in several industrial value chains in particular in the PV industry. The project will lead a strategic analysis on the potential of new EoL panels circular value chains based on estimated PV waste generation together with environmental and societal impact assessments. EVERPV has gathered a consortium of 16 participants from 8 countries whose expertise ranges from solar PV materials and recycling processes (CEA, CSEM, ENEA, TEC), recyclers (ENVIE, 9TECH), process industries and materials suppliers (SGB, DTF, DPL, JBR), PV modules manufacturing (VAL), collecting and waste treatment organizations (SOREN, ERION), policy-making, business and training facilitators (SPE, UNITAR, BI).
project.title: Highly efficient delamination technologies to recover and reuse metals, glass, polymers from end-of-life photovoltaic panels
project.keywords: photovoltaic panels, waste, recycling, delamination, silver, polymers, glass, IR irradiation, grinding, closed loop

article.title: Where do solar panels go when they die?

result.title: Report on the quality of the recovered glass and PET
result.description: This report will detail the characterization of PET and glass recovered from recycling process implemented in WP1 and implemented tasks in WP3. CSEM will lead this work.

result.title: Recovery of 30kg of Shredded glass with 99% purity
result.description: This WP3 report will contain the results of tests carried out for the validation of usability PV recycled glass in Saint Gobain's industrial process. Saint Gobain and CEA will participate.

result.title: Recovery of 100kg of PET with a 99% purity
result.description: This WP3 report will describe the recovery process of backsheet supplied by CEA to Depoly to reach the required throughputs. Revalorization of PET, PVDF will be detailed here. WP1 and WP3 are linked for that. DEPOLY, DTF, CSEM, TEC and CEA will participate.

result.title: Communication, Dissemination and Exploitation Plan
result.description: This WP9 report will present the establishment of the appropriate communication, dissemination, exploitation activities as well as means of communications to targeted audience. SOLAR POWER EUROPE will lead and all partners will participate.

result.title: Environmental, economic and social impact assessment of the EVERPV recycling process first period
result.description: This WP6 report will deal with Life Cycle Assessment (LCA), Life Cycling Costing (LCC) and social LCA analyses of the recycling technologies implemented during the project. ENEA will lead this activity, UNITAR, ERION, BECQUEREL INSTITUTE, SOLAR POWER EUROPE, CEA, 9TECH, ENVIE will participate.

result.title: Market assessment of PV and quantification of PV waste and waste streams in EU
result.description: This WP6 report will deal with market potential and waste generated from 2010 to 2030 and forecast future PV waste streams. UNITAR will lead and SPE, ERION, SOREN will participate.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - EVERPV (Highly efficient delamination technologies to recover and reuse metals, glass, polymers from end-of-life photovoltaic panels)
result.teaser: Production of renewable energy sources has considerably increased during the last two decades, especially through photovoltaic panels. With an average lifetime of a solar panel estimated at 25 years, those panels are now very close to their end of life. This represents and...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
